newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev closes softer at 227.50-229 to dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev closes softer at 227.50-229 to dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed between 227.50-229 per dollar, down from 226.50-228 in the morning with limited dollar sales by the central bank just slowing down the fall on the interbank market, dealers said.
"(Dollar) demand topped supply throughout the day, causing a lev fall by some three levs from Monday's close," a bank dealer said.
The lev closed at 224.50-226 per dollar on Monday.
Financial institutions and final clients sought foreign currency for short-covering and pending payments, while supply was low and came mainly from the central bank, traders said. @
The central bank was reported selling limited dollar volumes to final clients at 226.50 levs in the morning and 228 levs in the afternoon, dealers said.
Dollar-bullish sentiment has prevailed in the market since last Friday when a central interest rate cut became effective, traders said.

The lev closed at 222-223 per dollar last Thursday just before the rate cut to 20 percent monthly from 25 percent or 240 percent annually from 300 percent, announced by the central bank. -- Anastas Petrov, Sofia Newsroom, 359-2-84561
